segments.extra_info: The race starts in Blackheath, passing through Charlton and converging routes in Woolwich. Watch out for early excitement; maintain a steady pace.
Passing the Old Royal Naval College and approaching the Cutty Sark in Greenwich. Check your breathing and form.

segments.effort_level: Keep your pace comfortable. Focus on building momentum and your rhythm.
segments.extra_info: Running through Deptford and Surrey Quays, heading towards Bermondsey. Remember to drink before you get thirsty.
Crossing Tower Bridge, a significant landmark at the halfway point. Take nutrition if needed.
Heading east through Wapping towards Limehouse and into the Isle of Dogs. Maintain hydration.

segments.mental_focus: Prepare for mental challenges ahead. It's easy to forget, but steady breathing is key. Try breathing in a 2:1 ratio - in for 2 steps, out for 1
segments.extra_info: Navigating through Canary Wharf, with twists and turns. Focus on steady breathing.

segments.mental_focus: Push through fatigue. Evidence shows that smiling through pain can actually make the pain go away!
segments.extra_info: Returning west through Poplar and Limehouse, rejoining The Highway. Visualise the finish.
Passing the Tower of London, moving along the Embankment. Dig deep.

segments.mental_focus: Prepare for your finish line photo on The Mall!
segments.extra_info: Final stretch through Birdcage Walk, with views of Big Ben and Buckingham Palace. This is a busy area with loads of people in the crowd and more charity cheer stations. Soak in the moment!
